meanings.definition: To become stiff with cold or fear.
meanings.sent1: After falling into the icy water, he began to feeze from the cold.
meanings.sent2: The chilly wind made her feeze as she walked home.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie was so scary that it made me feeze in my seat.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news feezed her heart with fear.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the haunted house made her feeze in terror.

meanings.definition: To cause to become stiff with cold or fear.
meanings.sent1: The sudden gust of wind feezed her to the bone.
meanings.sent2: The ghost story feezed the children with fear.
meanings.sent3: His prank to scare her ended up feezing her with fright.
meanings.sent4: The intense stare from the stranger feezed him in place.
meanings.sent5: The icy water feezed his fingers numb.
